thread.title: Tamil Nadu: Heavy rain alert for Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts for next 3 days | Tamil Nadu News - News9live
thread.title_full: Tamil Nadu: Heavy rain alert for Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts for next 3 days | Tamil Nadu News - News9live

author: Ramkumar
title: Tamil Nadu: Heavy rain alert for Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts for next 3 days | Tamil Nadu News - News9live
text: Chennai: After the lull brief, it looks like the heavy rains are set to return in southern Tamil Nadu. Districts including Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli, and Kanyakumari tor receive moderate to heavy rains for the next 3 days, according to the Regional Meteorological Department’s forecast. Heavy rain alert in southern Tamil Nadu Moderate to heavy rain may occur at a couple of places in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal from tomorrow, December 30 due to variations in the speed of easterly winds, in Puduwai and Karaikal. According to the Meteorological Department, Kanyakumari and Tirunelveli districts are likely to experience heavy rains. Moderate rain to heavy rains may occur at a couple of places in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry Karaikal regions especially in districts like Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, and Ramanathapuram districts likely to receive heavy rainfall at one or two places from December 30 until January 1. The recent unprecedented rain that pounded Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts has left a trail of destruction and almost every household in Madurai, Tirunelveli, and Thoothukudi had been impacted by the relentless torrents of rain that lashed the region a couple of days ago. Chennai weather forecast As far as Chennai is concerned the sky will remain partly cloudy for the next 24 hours. Few parts of the city are likely to receive light rain. The maximum temperature is likely to be 30-31°C and the minimum temperature is 23-24°C.
